sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词都有"盖子，遮盖物"之意。
means: cover ： 泛指所有的遮盖物。包括盖子或书籍、杂志的封面等。
lid ： 通常指可以揭开的如箱盖、坛盖、壶盖等盖子。

word_mean: 保护：如以预防方法提供的保护，亦指为此而给予的预防措施

sentences.en: The problem was that with their cover blown they had nowhere to go.

jx.jx_en_mean: suddenly leave a place of shelter, especially vegetation, when being hunted or pursued
jx.jx_cn_mean: （被追捕时）突然从藏身处（尤其是丛林中）出来

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)foresee and avoid the possibility of attack or criticism
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)预见并避免受攻击（批评）

jx.jx_en_mean: conceal or gloss over many problems or defects
jx.jx_cn_mean: 隐瞒（掩饰）许多问题（缺点）

lj.lj_ly: stucco could cover a multitude of sins, including poor brickwork.
lj.lj_ls: 粉刷可以掩饰许多毛病，包括很差的砌砖工作。

jx.jx_en_mean: purchase securities in order to be able to fulfil a commitment to sell
jx.jx_cn_mean: 购买证券为了实现可以出售的承诺

jx.jx_en_mean: conceal evidence of what one has done
(N. Amer. informal)include a wide range of things; cover every aspect of something
jx.jx_cn_mean: (北美，非正式)涵盖很广；包括事物的各个方面

lj.lj_ly: while half the dishes are Italian, the kitchen covers the waterfront from Greece to Morocco.
lj.lj_ls: 尽管一半是意大利菜，炊事人员却来自五湖四海。

jx.jx_en_mean: from beginning to end of a book or magazine
jx.jx_cn_mean: 从（书或杂志的）第一页到最后一页，从头到尾

lj.lj_ly: the yacht made landfall under cover of darkness.
lj.lj_ls: 游艇在夜幕的掩护下靠岸了。

jx.jx_en_mean: in an envelope or parcel without any marks to identify the sender
jx.jx_cn_mean: 在未注明发送者的信封（包裹）内

jx.jx_en_mean: put something on, over, or around something, especially in order to conceal or disguise it
To conceal traces so as to elude pursuers.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 灭迹：掩盖痕迹以甩掉追踪者

jx.jx_en_mean: To traverse a given distance with satisfying speed.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 越过：以令人满意的速度越过指定距离

jx.jx_en_mean: To deal with or accomplish something in a certain manner
jx.jx_cn_mean: 处理，完成：以某种方式处理或完成某事

lj.lj_ly: The history course covered a lot of ground in six weeks.
lj.lj_ls: 历史课在六周内涉及很广

jx.jx_en_mean: To seek concealment or protection, as from enemy fire.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 躲藏：为躲避敌人火力而寻求躲藏或保护

entry.def: If you cover something, you place something else over it in order to protect it, hide it, or close it.

example.ex: Cover the casserole with a tight-fitting lid...
example.tran: 用大小合适的盖子盖住砂锅。

example.ex: He whimpered and covered his face...
example.tran: 他掩面抽泣。

entry.def: If one thing covers another, it has been placed over it in order to protect it, hide it, or close it.

example.ex: His finger went up to touch the black patch which covered his left eye...
example.tran: 他伸手去触摸遮住左眼的黑眼罩。

example.ex: His head was covered with a khaki turban.
example.tran: 他头上包着卡其布的穆斯林头巾。

entry.def: If one thing covers another, it forms a layer over its surface.

example.ex: The clouds had spread and nearly covered the entire sky...
example.tran: 云彩扩散开来，几乎遮住了整个天空。

example.ex: Two oil slicks are covering a total area of seven square miles...
example.tran: 两层浮油漂浮在7平方英里的区域上。

entry.def: To cover something with or in something else means to put a layer of the second thing over its surface.

example.ex: The trees in your garden may have covered the ground with apples, pears or plums...
example.tran: 你花园里的果树也许已经落了一地的苹果、梨或李子。

example.ex: She covered the walls with the signs of the zodiac.
example.tran: 她在墙上贴满了十二星座的标志。

entry.def: If you cover a particular distance, you travel that distance.

example.ex: It would not be easy to cover ten miles on that amount of petrol...
example.tran: 就那么点儿汽油很难开10英里。

example.ex: It covered the distance in 28 hours compared with the train's six days.
example.tran: 它走这一段要用28小时，与之相比火车要用6天。

entry.def: To cover someone or something means to protect them from attack, for example by pointing a gun in the direction of people who may attack them, ready to fire the gun if necessary.

example.ex: You go first. I'll cover you.
example.tran: 你先撤，我掩护你。

entry.def: Cover is protection from enemy attack that is provided for troops or ships carrying out a particular operation, for example by aircraft.

example.ex: They said they could not provide adequate air cover for ground operations.
example.tran: 他们声称无法为地面军事行动提供充分的空中掩护。

entry.def: Cover is trees, rocks, or other places where you shelter from the weather or from an attack, or hide from someone.

example.ex: Charles lit the fuses and they ran for cover.
example.tran: 查尔斯点燃了导火索，他们便赶紧四处躲避。

example.ex: ...barren wastes of field with no trees and no cover.
example.tran: 没有树木和其他遮蔽物的荒芜之地

entry.def: An insurance policy that covers a person or thing guarantees that money will be paid by the insurance company in relation to that person or thing.

example.ex: Their insurer paid the £900 bill, even though the policy did not strictly cover it...
example.tran: 虽然严格来讲保险单并不包含这一项，他们的保险公司还是支付了那张900英镑的账单。

example.ex: These items are not covered by your medical insurance...
example.tran: 这些项目不在你的医保范围之内。

entry.def: Insurance cover is a guarantee from an insurance company that money will be paid by them if it is needed.

example.ex: Make sure that the firm's insurance cover is adequate.
example.tran: 确保该公司上了足够的保险。

entry.def: If a law covers a particular set of people, things, or situations, it applies to them.

example.ex: The law covers four categories of experiments...
example.tran: 该法规适用于4类试验。

example.ex: Like any other commodity, pedigree dogs are covered by the Sale of Goods Act.
example.tran: 像其他商品一样，纯种狗的买卖同样受《货物买卖法》的约束。

entry.def: If you cover a particular topic, you discuss it in a lecture, course, or book.
entry.tran: (在演讲、课程或书中)讨论，涉及

example.ex: The Oxford Chemistry Primers aim to cover important topics in organic chemistry...
example.tran: 《牛津化学初级读本》丛书旨在论述有机化学中的重要问题。

example.ex: Other subjects covered included nerves and how to overcome them.
example.tran: 所涉及的其他主题包括焦虑及如何克服。

entry.def: If journalists, newspapers, or television companies cover an event, they report on it.

example.ex: Robinson was sent to Italy to cover the 1990 World Cup...
example.tran: 鲁宾逊被派到意大利报道1990年的世界杯比赛。

example.ex: The US news media will cover the trial closely.
example.tran: 美国新闻媒体将对该审判进行追踪报道。

entry.def: If a sum of money covers something, it is enough to pay for it.

example.ex: Send it to the address given with £1.50 to cover postage and administration...
example.tran: 将它寄到指定地址，并附上1.50英镑以支付邮资和管理费。

example.ex: Those figures might not even cover the cost of breakages.
example.tran: 那笔钱甚至都不够赔偿破损费。

entry.def: A cover is something which is put over an object, usually in order to protect it.

example.ex: ...a family room with washable covers on the furniture.
example.tran: 家具上套有可清洗外罩的家庭娱乐室

example.ex: ...a duvet cover.
example.tran: 羽绒被罩

entry.def: The covers on your bed are the things such as sheets and blankets that you have on top of you.

example.ex: She set her glass down and slid farther under the covers.
example.tran: 她放下杯子，钻进被子里。

entry.def: The cover of a book or a magazine is the outside part of it.

example.ex: A few years ago, David Byrne was on the cover of Time magazine.
example.tran: 几年前，大卫·拜恩曾登上《时代》周刊的封面。

example.ex: ...a small spiral-bound booklet with a green cover...
example.tran: 有绿色封皮的螺旋装订的活页小册子

entry.def: Something that is a cover for secret or illegal activities seems respectable or normal, and is intended to hide the activities.
entry.tran: (对秘密或违法之事的)掩盖，掩饰

example.ex: They set up a spurious temple that was a cover for sexual debauchery...
example.tran: 他们建立起一座为淫秽活动作掩护的假寺庙。

example.ex: As a cover story he generally tells people he is a freelance photographer.
example.tran: 为掩饰身份，他一般对外称自己是一名自由摄影师。

entry.def: If you cover for someone who is doing something secret or illegal, you give false information or do not give all the information you have, in order to protect them.
entry.tran: (通过提供假信息或不完全的信息来)遮掩，掩盖，包庇

example.ex: Why would she cover for someone who was trying to kill her?
example.tran: 她为什么要包庇想要杀她的人呢？

entry.def: If you cover for someone who is ill or away, you do their work for them while they are not there.

example.ex: She did not have enough nurses to cover for those who went ill or took holiday.
example.tran: 她没有足够的护士来顶替那些生病或休假的人工作。

entry.def: To cover a song originally performed by someone else means to record a new version of it.

example.ex: He must make a decent living from other artists covering his songs.
example.tran: 其他艺术家翻唱他的歌曲，一定使他过上了收入颇为可观的生活。

entry.def: A cover is the same as a cover version .

example.ex: The single is a cover of an old Rolling Stones song.
example.tran: 这支单曲是滚石乐队的一首老歌的翻唱。

entry.def: To blow someone's cover means to cause their true identity or the true nature of their work to be revealed.
entry.tran: 揭露，揭示(真实身份或工作的真实性质)

example.ex: Asking those kind of questions could blow my cover...
example.tran: 问那种问题会暴露我的身份。

example.ex: The young man looked embarrassed, as if he were a spy whose cover had been blown.
example.tran: 那个年轻人看起来局促不安，就好像他是一个身份暴露的间谍一样。

entry.def: If you break cover, you leave a place where you have been hiding or sheltering from attack, usually in order to run to another place.
entry.tran: (通常为到达另一地点)离开隐蔽处，冲出躲藏处

example.ex: They began running again, broke cover and dashed towards the road.
example.tran: 他们又开始跑，离开隐蔽处朝公路冲去。

entry.def: If you take cover, you shelter from gunfire, bombs, or the weather.
entry.tran: 躲避(炮火、轰炸或坏天气)

example.ex: Shoppers took cover behind cars as police marksmen returned fire.
example.tran: 警方的射击手开火回击时，购物者们躲在汽车后面。

entry.def: If you are under cover, you are under something that protects you from gunfire, bombs, or the weather.
entry.tran: 在…的遮掩下(躲避炮火轰炸、坏天气等)

example.ex: 'Get under cover!' shouted Billy, and we darted once more for the tables.
example.tran: “躲起来！”比利喊道，我们便又一次冲向桌子。

entry.def: If you do something under cover of a particular situation, you are able to do it without being noticed because of that situation.

example.ex: They move under cover of darkness.
example.tran: 他们在黑暗的掩护下行进。

entry.def: If you cover your back or cover your rear, you do something in order to protect yourself, for example against criticism or against accusations of doing something wrong.
entry.tran: 保护自己(免受批评、谴责等);辩解

example.ex: The canny Premier covered his back by pointing out that he was of Scottish stock.
example.tran: 精明狡猾的首相辩解说自己是苏格兰血统。

entry.def: Cover your ass means the same as cover your back .

example.ex: Just play it safe, cover your ass, keep your head down.
example.tran: 要谨慎行事，保护好自己并保持低调。

means.word_mean: 1. a covering that serves to conceal or shelter something;

sentences.sentence: "they crouched behind the screen"
"under cover of darkness"

means.word_mean: 2. bedding that keeps a person warm in bed;

sentences.sentence: "he pulled the covers over his head and went to sleep"

means.word_mean: 3. the act of concealing the existence of something by obstructing the view of it;

sentences.sentence: "the cover concealed their guns from enemy aircraft"

means.word_mean: 4. the front and back covering of a book;

sentences.sentence: "the book had a leather binding"

means.word_mean: 5. a natural object that covers or envelops;

sentences.sentence: "under a covering of dust"
"the fox was flushed from its cover"

means.word_mean: 6. covering for a hole (especially a hole in the top of a container);

sentences.sentence: "he removed the top of the carton"
"he couldn't get the top off of the bottle"
"put the cover back on the kettle"

means.word_mean: 7. fire that makes it difficult for the enemy to fire on your own individuals or formations;

sentences.sentence: "artillery provided covering fire for the withdrawal"

means.word_mean: 8. a fixed charge by a restaurant or night club over and above the charge for food and drink
9. a recording of a song that was first recorded or made popular by somebody else;

sentences.sentence: "they made a cover of a Beatles' song"

means.word_mean: 10. a false identity and background (especially one created for an undercover agent);

sentences.sentence: "her new name and passport are cover for her next assignment"

means.word_mean: 1. provide with a covering or cause to be covered;

sentences.sentence: "cover her face with a handkerchief"
"cover the child with a blanket"
"cover the grave with flowers"

means.word_mean: 2. form a cover over;

sentences.sentence: "The grass covered the grave"

means.word_mean: 3. span an interval of distance, space or time;

sentences.sentence: "The war extended over five years"
"The period covered the turn of the century"
"My land extends over the hills on the horizon"
"This farm covers some 200 acres"

means.word_mean: 4. provide for;

sentences.sentence: "The grant doesn't cover my salary"

means.word_mean: 5. deal with verbally or in some form of artistic expression;

sentences.sentence: "This book deals with incest"
"The course covered all of Western Civilization"
"The new book treats the history of China"

means.word_mean: 6. include in scope; include as part of something broader; have as one's sphere or territory;

sentences.sentence: "This group encompasses a wide range of people from different backgrounds"
"this should cover everyone in the group"

means.word_mean: 7. travel across or pass over;

sentences.sentence: "The caravan covered almost 100 miles each day"

means.word_mean: 8. be responsible for reporting the details of, as in journalism;

sentences.sentence: "Snow reported on China in the 1950's"
"The cub reporter covered New York City"

means.word_mean: 9. hold within range of an aimed firearm
10. to take an action to protect against future problems;

sentences.sentence: "Count the cash in the drawer twice just to cover yourself"

means.word_mean: 11. hide from view or knowledge;

sentences.sentence: "The President covered the fact that he bugged the offices in the White House"

means.word_mean: 12. protect or defend (a position in a game);

sentences.sentence: "he covered left field"

means.word_mean: 13. maintain a check on; especially by patrolling;

sentences.sentence: "The second officer covered the top floor"

means.word_mean: 14. protect by insurance;

sentences.sentence: "The insurance won't cover this"

means.word_mean: 15. make up for shortcomings or a feeling of inferiority by exaggerating good qualities;

sentences.sentence: "he is compensating for being a bad father"

means.word_mean: 16. invest with a large or excessive amount of something;

sentences.sentence: "She covered herself with glory"

means.word_mean: 17. help out by taking someone's place and temporarily assuming his responsibilities;

sentences.sentence: "She is covering for our secretary who is ill this week"

means.word_mean: 18. be sufficient to meet, defray, or offset the charge or cost of;

sentences.sentence: "Is this enough to cover the check?"

means.word_mean: 19. spread over a surface to conceal or protect;

sentences.sentence: "This paint covers well"

means.word_mean: 20. cover as if with a shroud;

sentences.sentence: "The origins of this civilization are shrouded in mystery"

means.word_mean: 21. copulate with a female, used especially of horses;

sentences.sentence: "The horse covers the mare"

means.word_mean: 22. put something on top of something else;

sentences.sentence: "cover the meat with a lot of gravy"

means.word_mean: 23. play a higher card than the one previously played;

sentences.sentence: "Smith covered again"

means.word_mean: 24. be responsible for guarding an opponent in a game
25. sit on (eggs);

sentences.sentence: "Birds brood"
"The female covers the eggs"

means.word_mean: 26. clothe, as if for protection from the elements;

sentences.sentence: "cover your head!"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French covrir, from Latin cooperire, from co- (expressing intensive force) + operire 'to cover'. The noun is partly a variant of covert

sentences.cn: 他以公务员的工作作为搞间谍活动的掩护。
sentences.en: His work as a civil servant was a cover for his activities as a spy.

sentences.cn: 一到达敌方的水域，船只就需要空中掩护。
sentences.en: The ships needed air cover (= protection by military planes) once they reached enemy waters.

sentences.cn: 掩护我前进。
sentences.en: Cover me while I move forward.

sentences.cn: 他们建立起一座为淫秽活动作掩护的假寺庙。
sentences.en: They set up a spurious temple that was a cover for sexual debauchery...

sentences.cn: 他们在黑暗的掩护下行进。
sentences.en: They move under cover of darkness.

sentences.cn: 你先撤，我掩护你。
sentences.en: You go first. I'll cover you.

sentences.cn: 他们声称无法为地面军事行动提供充分的空中掩护。
sentences.en: They said they could not provide adequate air cover for ground operations.

sentences.cn: 描述: 一名刚从直升机上下来的陆战队士兵趴在一片农田里进行掩护.
sentences.en: Caption: A Marine took cover in a farm field after landing by helicopter.

sentences.cn: 为进行这次军事行动,我们需要充足的空中掩护.
sentences.en: For this operation we need plenty of air cover , ie protection by military aircraft.

sentences.cn: 我们用火掩护他冲过空地.
sentences.en: We gave him covering fire as he dashed across the clearing.

sentences.cn: 许多掩护, 但是许多平民得到被跳飞注射杀.
sentences.en: Lots of cover, but lots of civilians to get killed by ricochet shots.

sentences.cn: 那罪犯在夜幕的掩护下逃走了.
sentences.en: The criminal escaped under the cover of darkness.

sentences.cn: 当火箭的方法, 只有15秒跑作掩护.
sentences.en: When a rocket approaches, people have only 15 seconds to run for cover.

sentences.cn: 在夜幕的掩护下,增援力量被派到了河的对岸.
sentences.en: Reinforcements were sent across the river under cover of darkness.

sentences.cn: 他们原来的意图只是掩护我们退却.
sentences.en: Their original intention was simply to cover our retreat.

sentences.cn: 在夜幕的掩护下我们袭击了敌人.
sentences.en: We attacked the enemy under cover of night.

sentences.cn: 他用了别的姓,作为这次任务的掩护.
sentences.en: He took a different surname as part of his cover for the mission.

sentences.cn: 左侧需要掩护火力!
sentences.en: Need covering fire left flank!

sentences.en: When fleeing from an enemy, you will be shot to death, inches away from your cover.

sentences.en: EX The troop withdrew safely under the cover of darkness.
